people_question_1.response: We encourage our payroll team to attend industry conferences or webinars on payroll compliance.
We utilise training programs or certifications offered by professional payroll associations.
We subscribe to online resources or newsletters that provide updates on payroll regulations.
We have a dedicated resource person within the company who stays updated and informs the team.
We don't have a structured approach to ensure our payroll team are updated on changes; attend training, undertake professional development or are a member of a payroll association.

people_question_3.response: Yes, we use a tailored skill and knowledge self-assessment tool so the payroll team can proactively identify their knowledge and skill strengths and gaps to build our team training and development activity. New recuits to the pay team do a knowledge assessment as part of our selection process.
Yes, we broadly rate the team's knowledge and skills as part of the performance appraisal process and develop individual training plans.
We encourage the pay team to self-identify gaps in their knowledge and skills and to request to attend relevant training, seminars, workshops.

We are aware there may be skill and knowledge gaps within the pay team and we need to continue to improve our process to identify what these are and put a plan in place to build and maintain competence.
We have not considered this. Can you provide me with more information?

process_question_2.response: We use a formal change authorisation and approval process that is documented.
We have data accuracy and validation checks in place to ensure all pay-related changes are accurate, complete and consistent with employee records.
We conduct regular audits of employee data and payroll entries to ensure accuracy and consistency.
We have a cross-verification process of data entries by more than one pay team member, especially for complex changes, to minimise the risk of error.
We regularly undertake comprehensive payroll auditing and reconciliation to help identify and rectify payroll errors before finalising.
We don't have a structured approach to manage pay related changes.

process_question_3.response: Applicable Modern Award: Which Modern Award /s is applicable to your workforce?
Classification level: Of an employee / group of employees under the applicable award or enterprise agreement?
Award & Enterprise Agreement Interpretation: Keeping up with changes in award and enterprise agreement rules?
Employee Classification: Ensuring staff are classified correctly under the relevant award or agreement?
Tax & Superannuation: Applying the right PAYG tables and making timely super contributions?
Time & Attendance Tracking & Pay Calculations: Accurately tracking employee hours and applying the correct pay rates?
Payroll System Errors: Experiencing any technical issues with your payroll system that lead to mis-payments?
Underpayment: Of an employee / group of employees?
Overpayment: Of an employee / group of employees?

compliance_question_1.response: Yes - We have employees on an annualised salary arrangement and these are reviewed regularly (at least once a year)
Yes - We have employees on an annualised salary arrangement however we do not review these regularly
No - We do not have any employees on an annualised salary arrangement

compliance_question_3.response: Yes: We have conducted internal AND external audits for payroll over the last 12 months.
Yes: We have conducted an internal OR an external payroll audit in the last 12 months.

system_question_2.response: Yes: We use a HRIS and it is integrated with our payroll and finance systems.
Yes: We use a HRIS and it is integrated with our payroll system.
Yes: We use a HRIS and an electronic payroll system however they are not fully integrated.
No: We do not use an HRIS however we have an electronic payroll system.
No: We do not use an HRIS and our payroll system is manual.

culture_question_1.response: Established clear policies and procedures for all payroll processes
Established more efficient communication and effective engagement between Payroll, relevant departments (such as HR) and managers
Evaluated current payroll software provider and system processes
Introduced an automated and integrated payroll and/or Rostering / Time&Attendance / HR / accounting system(s)
Developed a detailed payroll calendar & checklist per pay period
Improved controls on Time & Attendance introduced
Improved consistency of and access to ongoing education and updates on the latest legislative and tax updates
Introduced a risk mitigation and continuous improvement plan for the payroll function

culture_question_2.response: Yes, I see opportunities for cost reduction and compliance improvement, and we have a budget allocated for these changes.
Yes, I see opportunities for improvement, but we would need to adjust our budget to accommodate these changes.
Yes, there are opportunities for cost reduction and compliance improvement, but we do not currently have a budget for these changes.
Yes, there are potential improvements, but we need to assess our budget flexibility to determine if we can accommodate these changes.
No, I do not see any opportunities for reducing costs or improving compliance and governance at this time.
